DOC.brief_title: Educational Support Interventions for Children in Care
DOC.detailed_description: A Randomized controlled study of two different educational support interventions developed for children in foster care (age 6-13). One intervention is school-based and involves a team of professionals at the child's school, and the other is a home-based tutoring intervention provided by the foster parents. The participants in the study are assigned to three groups (the two intervention groups and control group). Based on power calculation we aim to recruit approximately 180-200 foster children, their foster parents and public schools to participate in the study.
DOC.criteria: age 613 fostercare placement placement in a participating municipality persuasive developmental disorders special education students
